messages.title: Why is Alun standing to become an MP?
messages.content: Alun is standing for several reasons: he is angry about the decision to leave the EU. He is disappointed that Theresa May has called an election. Alun is concerned about the actions of THERESA MAY. He wants to repeal Article 50. He does not share trust in Theresa May being a Brexiteer.

messages.title: How we can change the future together
messages.content: We in UKIP would decrease the Foreign Aid Budget which currently stands at Â£31 million pounds per day. Monies we could spend on the NHS and social care. We will dump A&E closure plans and give the green light to ensure that money is made available to reopen and establish new emergency wards within hospitals.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Decrease the Foreign Aid Budget to spend more on the NHS and social care.
Dump A&E closure plans and ensure funding for reopening and establishing new emergency wards.
Proposes 'BED BLOCKING' would be stopped after Brexit.
Following Brexit, wants to ensure hospitals are staffed sufficiently to meet demand by employing medics from the EU and worldwide.

issues.brexitEurope: Alun mentions his disagreement with the decision to leave the EU and his desire to repeal Article 50.
issues.health: Plans to increase funding to the NHS by decreasing the Foreign Aid Budget. Intends to dump A&E closure plans.
issues.immigration: After Brexit, Alun wants to ensure hospitals are staffed sufficiently by medics from the EU and worldwide.

housing.content: 'BED BLOCKING' would be stopped after Brexit.

politicalExperience.role: Senior Manager in the prison service
politicalExperience.achievements: Works for Cat C and Vulnerable Prisoners
